meanings.definition: In a collegiate manner or style.
meanings.sent1: She ran collegiately during the race, showing great teamwork with her teammates.
meanings.sent2: The team played collegiately, following the rules and supporting each other.
meanings.sent3: The students danced collegiately at the school event, moving in sync and having fun.
meanings.sent4: The choir sang collegiately, harmonizing perfectly and captivating the audience.
meanings.sent5: He spoke collegiately, using respectful language and addressing everyone politely.

meanings.definition: In relation to or involving colleges or college students.
meanings.sent1: The collegiately themed party had decorations representing various universities.
meanings.sent2: She wore a collegiately inspired outfit, with a sweatshirt from her favorite college.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked collegiately dressed in a tiny sweater with a college logo.
meanings.sent4: The room was decorated collegiately, with posters of different college mascots.
meanings.sent5: He felt collegiately connected to his alma mater, attending all the alumni events.
